thread.title: Lupita Nyong'o to lead Broadway transfer of 'Eclipsed'
thread.title_full: Lupita Nyong'o to lead Broadway transfer of 'Eclipsed' - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Lupita Nyong'o to lead Broadway transfer of 'Eclipsed'
text:
From left: Pascale Armand, Saycon Sengbloh, and Lupita Nyong’o are a rebel general's wives who do whatever it takes to survive in "Eclipsed." Lupita Nyong’o’s already got an Oscar. Now a Tony is in her grasp.
The Public Theater production of “Eclipsed,” an ensemble drama about Liberian women caught in the crossfire of civil war, will transfer to Broadway this winter following its run downtown that ends Nov. 29.
Nyong’o will reprise her role as one of four “wives” of a rebel warlord in the drama by “The Walking Dead” actress Danai Gurira.
The Daily News called the play “brilliant but blunt” and noted that Nygong’o’s “gripping and assured work oozes emotion and anchors this production.”
Previews are set to begin on Broadway on Feb. 23 prior to an official opening night on March 6 at the Golden Theatre.
jdziemianowicz@nydailynews.com
